Query: Unix/Linux find and sort by date modified

Answers.MP Summary: print or set the system date and time
Top-3 Similar Questions: su_1598430: Date, find out the number of days in a month
so_18339307: Find files in created between a date range
so_41015725: find a date in a powershell variable
Top-3 Scripts:
su_1598430: month=$(date +%m)
maxDayThisMonth=$(( for d in {00..31}; do date -d "+$d days" +%m-%d ; done ; ) | grep -Po "(?<=$month-)\d+" | sort -rn | head -1)

nextMonth=$(printf "%02d" $(( ($month+1) % 12 )) )
maxDayNextMonth=$(( for d in {01..62}; do date -d "+$d days" +%m-%d ; done ; ) | grep -Po "(?<=$nextMonth-)\d+" | sort -rn | head -1)

so_18339307: find ~/ -mtime $(echo $(date +%s) - $(date +%s -d"Dec 31, 2009 23:59:59") | bc -l | awk '{print $1 / 86400}' | bc -l)

find . -mtime $(date +%s -d"Aug 10, 2013 23:59:59") -mtime $(date +%s -d"Aug 1, 2013 23:59:59")

Explanations about Options.-d: display time described by STRING, not 'now'

Explanations about Options.-n: compare according to string numerical value

so_29526886: unix find oldest file in directory by date in filename
so_16757326: Linux Find: How to find .PDF files created after a specific year?
so_60835418: Bash: find all files based on date range in file names
Top-3 Scripts:
so_16757326: tmp=$(mktemp /tmp/time-XXXXXXXX)
touch -t 200801010000 "$tmp"
find . -type f -iname '*.pdf' -newer "$tmp"
rm "$tmp"

Explanations about Options.-t:
STAMP
 use [[CC]YY]MMDDhhmm[.ss] instead of current time
